org.js4ms.server

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.js4ms.server.Connection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SocketConnection

    public abstract class Connection
extends Object
    An abstract base class for persistent client-server connections.
    Author:
    Greg Bumgardner (gbumgard)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected String identifier
      Unique identifier used to retrieve connection instances managed by a ConnectionManager.
      protected PushbackInputStream inputStream
      The InputStream used to read data from the connection.
      protected Log log
      Helper object used to construct log messages.
      static Logger logger
      The Logger for Connection objects.
      protected OutputStream outputStream
      The OutputStream used to send data over the connection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Connection() 
      protected Connection(InputStream inputStream, OutputStream outputStream) 
      protected Connection(String identifier, InputStream inputStream, OutputStream outputStream)
      Protected constructor used by derived classes to specify the input stream, output stream, and client host address for the connection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        protected Connection()

      • Connection

        protected Connection(String identifier,
          InputStream inputStream,
          OutputStream outputStream)
        Protected constructor used by derived classes to specify the input stream, output stream, and client host address for the connection.
        Parameters:
        identifier - - A String containing an identifier that is unique within the context of the associated Server instance.
        inputStream - - The stream that will be used to receive data from the client.
        outputStream - - The stream that will be used to send data to the client.

      • Connection

        protected Connection(InputStream inputStream,
          OutputStream outputStream)

    • Method Detail

      • getIdentifier

        public final String getIdentifier()
        Gets the connection identifier.
        Returns:

      • setIdentifier

        public final void setIdentifier(String identifier)
        Sets the connection identifier. The identifier must be unique within the context of a Server instance. This method should not be used while the connection is registered with a ConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        identifier - - A String containing a unique identifier.

      • getRemoteAddress

        public abstract InetSocketAddress getRemoteAddress()

      • getInputStream

        public final PushbackInputStream getInputStream()
        Returns an input stream that can be used to receive data from the client.
        Returns:

      • setInputStream

        public final void setInputStream(PushbackInputStream inputStream)
        Sets the input stream used to receive data. Typically used to bind this connection to the input stream of another connection for tunneling purposes.
        Parameters:
        inputStream -

      • getOutputStream

        public final OutputStream getOutputStream()
        Returns an output stream that can be used to send data to the client.
        Returns:

      • setOutputStream

        public final void setOutputStream(OutputStream outputStream)
        Sets the output stream used to send data. Typically used to bind this connection to the output stream of another connection for tunneling purposes.
        Parameters:
        inputStream -

      • shutdownInput

        public abstract void shutdownInput()
                            throws IOException
        Disables the connection InputStream. Data received from connection peer is silently discarded. Used to provide non-abortive shutdown of connection. The InputStream will return EOF (-1) if an attempt is made to read from the stream after this method has been called.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • shutdownOutput

        public abstract void shutdownOutput()
                             throws IOException
        Disables the connection OutputStream. The connection peer is notified that no more data will be sent (FIN). Used to provide non-abortive shutdown of connection; after calling this method, call shutdownInput() or read the InputStream until EOF and then call close(). The OutputStream will thrown an IOException if an attempt is made to write to the stream after this method has been called.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • close

        public abstract void close()
                    throws IOException
        Closes the connection. The connection with the peer is aborted and any threads waiting to read from the connection will throw a SocketException.
        Throws:
        IOException
